Token.Abstract:
The name of the table you want to create. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, _ (underscore), - (hyphen) and . (period).

Constraints:
Length: 3 - 255
Pattern: [a-zA-Z0-9_.-]+

The name of the table you want to create. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, _ (underscore), - (hyphen) and . (period).

Constraints:
Length: 3 - 255
Pattern: [a-zA-Z0-9_.-]+

The KeySchema identifies the primary key as a one attribute primary key (hash) or a composite two attribute (hash-and-range) primary key. Single attribute primary keys have one index value: a HashKeyElement. A composite hash-and-range primary key contains two attribute values: a HashKeyElement and a RangeKeyElement.

The KeySchema identifies the primary key as a one attribute primary key (hash) or a composite two attribute (hash-and-range) primary key. Single attribute primary keys have one index value: a HashKeyElement. A composite hash-and-range primary key contains two attribute values: a HashKeyElement and a RangeKeyElement.

Provisioned throughput reserves the required read and write resources for your table in terms of ReadCapacityUnits and WriteCapacityUnits. Values for provisioned throughput depend upon your expected read/write rates, item size, and consistency. Provide the expected number of read and write operations, assuming an item size of 1k and strictly consistent reads. For 2k item size, double the value. For 3k, triple the value, etc. Eventually-consistent reads consume half the resources of strictly consistent reads.

Provisioned throughput reserves the required read and write resources for your table in terms of ReadCapacityUnits and WriteCapacityUnits. Values for provisioned throughput depend upon your expected read/write rates, item size, and consistency. Provide the expected number of read and write operations, assuming an item size of 1k and strictly consistent reads. For 2k item size, double the value. For 3k, triple the value, etc. Eventually-consistent reads consume half the resources of strictly consistent reads.
Default constructor for a new CreateTableRequest object. Callers should use the property methods to initialize this object after creating it.
Constructs a new CreateTableRequest object. Callers should use properties to initialize any additional object members.

Parameter.Name: theTableName
Parameter.Abstract: The name of the table you want to create. Allowed characters are a-z, A-Z, 0-9, _ (underscore), - (hyphen) and . (period).

Parameter.Name: theKeySchema
Parameter.Abstract: The KeySchema identifies the primary key as a one attribute primary key (hash) or a composite two attribute (hash-and-range) primary key. Single attribute primary keys have one index value: a HashKeyElement. A composite hash-and-range primary key contains two attribute values: a HashKeyElement and a RangeKeyElement.

Parameter.Name: theProvisionedThroughput
Parameter.Abstract: Provisioned throughput reserves the required read and write resources for your table in terms of ReadCapacityUnits and WriteCapacityUnits. Values for provisioned throughput depend upon your expected read/write rates, item size, and consistency. Provide the expected number of read and write operations, assuming an item size of 1k and strictly consistent reads. For 2k item size, double the value. For 3k, triple the value, etc. Eventually-consistent reads consume half the resources of strictly consistent reads.

Token.Abstract: Returns a string representation of this object; useful for testing and debugging.

ReturnValue.Abstract: A string representation of this object.
